revised_title: Investigating the Currents and Their Effects on Ship Navigation
tldr: The author, James Rennell, investigates the current that often prevails to the westward of Scilly, which endangers the safety of ships approaching the British Channel. He explores the possible causes of this current, such as the prevalence of westerly winds in the Atlantic, and its effects on ship navigation. Rennell also discusses the importance of understanding these currents to ensure the safety of seafarers.
